oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1943-01-02 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from January 2, 1943. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Bashful Brother Oswald, Rachel Veach, Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys with vocalist San Antonio Rose, Pap's Jug Band, Ford Rush, Minnie Pearl, and Art Wooten. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN. Recording begins with the end of the previous Opry segment.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rachel Veach; Pee Wee King; Golden West Cowboys; San Antonio Rose; Pap's Jug Band
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Closing theme -- Announcer closing statement (incomplete) -- Opening statement (Louie Buck) -- Opening theme -- Louie Buck introduces George D. Hay -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys with Rachel Veach -- Night Train To Memphis (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Rachel Veach) -- George D. Hay introduces Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys with San Antonio Rose -- I Wanna Be A Cowboy's Sweetheart (Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys, San Antonio Rose) -- George D. Hay introduces Pap's Jug Band -- I Wish I Was Single Again (Pap's Jug Band) -- Prince Albert commercial (George D. Hay, Louie Buck) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff -- I'll Reap My Harvest In Heaven (Roy Acuff)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Bashful Brother Oswald; Veach, Rachel; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; King, Pee Wee, 1914-2000; Golden West Cowboys (Musical group); Pap's Jug Band; Wilson, Lonnie; Minnie Pearl; Rush, Ford, 1895-; Wooten, Art, 1906-1986
